TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BodyWriter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the writer of the message body.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A message consists of headers and a body. The headers are buffered and the body is streamed. Because the body is streamed, the user cannot pass the actual content of the body to a message. Instead the user must pass a class that knows how to write the body when asked to do so. This is done by passing a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message>. A message calls the class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> whenever it requires the body to be written using an <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
## Examples The following example shows how to derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter>. This override takes in an array of strings and writes them to a <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter>.
[!code-csharp[S_UEBodyWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[S_UEBodyWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/vb/module1.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> is `true` then the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> object is returned. If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> is `false` then the contents of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> up to `maxBufferSize` is returned. This also calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnCreateBufferedCopy%28System.Int32%29> as an extensibility point.
## Examples The following sample shows how to create a buffered copy of an existing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> instance.
[!code-csharp[S_UEBodyWriter#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/cs/snippets.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UEBodyWriter#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/vb/snippets.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The body has already been written and cannot be written again, or the body writer is not buffered.

Docs.param: The maximum size of the buffer for the body.
Docs.summary: Provides an extensibility point when the body contents are written.
Docs.returns: The with the specified maximum buffer size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> can override this method to create a buffered copy of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter>. But the default implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.WriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29>, so overriding just <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> should be easier and work for most scenarios.
Note that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> returned must be buffered, that is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> must be `true`.

Docs.param: The used to write out the message body.
Docs.summary: When implemented, provides an extensibility point when the body contents are written.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method must be implemented by classes derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter>. This is the key method that writes the body. If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> is buffered then this method is called only once.
## Examples The following example illustrates an override of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> method.
[!code-csharp[S_UEBodyWriter#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[S_UEBodyWriter#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uebodywriter/vb/module1.vb#3)]

member this.WriteBodyContents : System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter -> unit

Docs.param: The used to write out the message body.
Docs.summary: Writes out the contents of the message body.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.WriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29>, so overriding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> provides the best point of extension.
